column1: Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #435996 - - Mac OS Deployment Script is not working (Setting Server IP) [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Lx01X:ref ]
To gather the needed logs, please go to Device Control -> Computers or Users and filter for the PC name or User name, and hit Apply
In the Action menu of the computer/user, select Manage settings
In the Debug Mode section please select Debug from the dropdown and Save
After this please update the policies on the Computer and run the change IP script in order for the logs to be generated.
Return to the Console and go to Device Control -> Computers or users and repeat the same filter as before
In the Actions menu please select Collect Diagnostics and after 10-20 minutes In the same menu choose Go to Diagnostics Data
In the table press on the download icon from the Actions column and send the archive as an attachment
[Inline image name : image013.png]Once the archive is sent, please return to the computer/user settings and disable the debug mode in one of the two ways depending on what the case is.
If you want to return the computer to the Global settings, then press the Restore Global/Default Settings button at the bottom of the page.
If you have custom rules or settings for the computer, after disabling the debug mode, just hit Save.

Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #435996 - - Mac OS Deployment Script is not working (Setting Server IP) [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Lx01X:ref ]
To gather the needed logs, please go to Device Control -> Computers or Users and filter for the PC name or User name, and hit Apply
In the Action menu of the computer/user, select Manage settings
In the Debug Mode section please select Debug from the dropdown and Save
After this please update the policies on the Computer and run the change IP script in order for the logs to be generated.
Return to the Console and go to Device Control -> Computers or users and repeat the same filter as before
In the Actions menu please select Collect Diagnostics and after 10-20 minutes In the same menu choose Go to Diagnostics Data
In the table press on the download icon from the Actions column and send the archive as an attachment
[cid:image013.png@01DB98BB.95DD82B0]Once the archive is sent, please return to the computer/user settings and disable the debug mode in one of the two ways depending on what the case is.
If you want to return the computer to the Global settings, then press the Restore Global/Default Settings button at the bottom of the page.
If you have custom rules or settings for the computer, after disabling the debug mode, just hit Save.

column1: Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #435996 - - Mac OS Deployment Script is not working (Setting Server IP) [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Lx01X:ref ]
To gather the needed logs, please go to Device Control -> Computers or Users and filter for the PC name or User name, and hit Apply
In the Action menu of the computer/user, select Manage settings
In the Debug Mode section please select Debug from the dropdown and Save
After this please update the policies on the Computer and run the change IP script in order for the logs to be generated.
Return to the Console and go to Device Control -> Computers or users and repeat the same filter as before
In the Actions menu please select Collect Diagnostics and after 10-20 minutes In the same menu choose Go to Diagnostics Data
In the table press on the download icon from the Actions column and send the archive as an attachment
[Inline image name : image013.png]Once the archive is sent, please return to the computer/user settings and disable the debug mode in one of the two ways depending on what the case is.
If you want to return the computer to the Global settings, then press the Restore Global/Default Settings button at the bottom of the page.
If you have custom rules or settings for the computer, after disabling the debug mode, just hit Save.

column1: Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #435996 - - Mac OS Deployment Script is not working (Setting Server IP) [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Lx01X:ref ]
To gather the needed logs, please go to Device Control -> Computers or Users and filter for the PC name or User name, and hit Apply
In the Action menu of the computer/user, select Manage settings
In the Debug Mode section please select Debug from the dropdown and Save
After this please update the policies on the Computer and run the change IP script in order for the logs to be generated.
Return to the Console and go to Device Control -> Computers or users and repeat the same filter as before
In the Actions menu please select Collect Diagnostics and after 10-20 minutes In the same menu choose Go to Diagnostics Data
In the table press on the download icon from the Actions column and send the archive as an attachment
[Inline image name : image013.png]Once the archive is sent, please return to the computer/user settings and disable the debug mode in one of the two ways depending on what the case is.
If you want to return the computer to the Global settings, then press the Restore Global/Default Settings button at the bottom of the page.
If you have custom rules or settings for the computer, after disabling the debug mode, just hit Save.

column1: Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #435996 - - Mac OS Deployment Script is not working (Setting Server IP) [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Lx01X:ref ]
To gather the needed logs, please go to Device Control -> Computers or Users and filter for the PC name or User name, and hit Apply
In the Action menu of the computer/user, select Manage settings
In the Debug Mode section please select Debug from the dropdown and Save
After this please update the policies on the Computer and run the change IP script in order for the logs to be generated.
Return to the Console and go to Device Control -> Computers or users and repeat the same filter as before
In the Actions menu please select Collect Diagnostics and after 10-20 minutes In the same menu choose Go to Diagnostics Data
In the table press on the download icon from the Actions column and send the archive as an attachment
[Inline image name : image013.png]Once the archive is sent, please return to the computer/user settings and disable the debug mode in one of the two ways depending on what the case is.
If you want to return the computer to the Global settings, then press the Restore Global/Default Settings button at the bottom of the page.
If you have custom rules or settings for the computer, after disabling the debug mode, just hit Save.

Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #435996 - - Mac OS Deployment Script is not working (Setting Server IP) [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Lx01X:ref ]
To gather the needed logs, please go to Device Control -> Computers or Users and filter for the PC name or User name, and hit Apply
In the Action menu of the computer/user, select Manage settings
In the Debug Mode section please select Debug from the dropdown and Save
After this please update the policies on the Computer and run the change IP script in order for the logs to be generated.
Return to the Console and go to Device Control -> Computers or users and repeat the same filter as before
In the Actions menu please select Collect Diagnostics and after 10-20 minutes In the same menu choose Go to Diagnostics Data
In the table press on the download icon from the Actions column and send the archive as an attachment
[cid:image013.png@01DB9CB2.308054B0]Once the archive is sent, please return to the computer/user settings and disable the debug mode in one of the two ways depending on what the case is.
If you want to return the computer to the Global settings, then press the Restore Global/Default Settings button at the bottom of the page.
If you have custom rules or settings for the computer, after disabling the debug mode, just hit Save.

column1: Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #435996 - - Mac OS Deployment Script is not working (Setting Server IP) [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Lx01X:ref ]
To gather the needed logs, please go to Device Control -> Computers or Users and filter for the PC name or User name, and hit Apply
In the Action menu of the computer/user, select Manage settings
In the Debug Mode section please select Debug from the dropdown and Save
After this please update the policies on the Computer and run the change IP script in order for the logs to be generated.
Return to the Console and go to Device Control -> Computers or users and repeat the same filter as before
In the Actions menu please select Collect Diagnostics and after 10-20 minutes In the same menu choose Go to Diagnostics Data
In the table press on the download icon from the Actions column and send the archive as an attachment
[Inline image name : image013.png]Once the archive is sent, please return to the computer/user settings and disable the debug mode in one of the two ways depending on what the case is.
If you want to return the computer to the Global settings, then press the Restore Global/Default Settings button at the bottom of the page.
If you have custom rules or settings for the computer, after disabling the debug mode, just hit Save.

Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #435996 - - Mac OS Deployment Script is not working (Setting Server IP) [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Lx01X:ref ]
To gather the needed logs, please go to Device Control -> Computers or Users and filter for the PC name or User name, and hit Apply
In the Action menu of the computer/user, select Manage settings
In the Debug Mode section please select Debug from the dropdown and Save
After this please update the policies on the Computer and run the change IP script in order for the logs to be generated.
Return to the Console and go to Device Control -> Computers or users and repeat the same filter as before
In the Actions menu please select Collect Diagnostics and after 10-20 minutes In the same menu choose Go to Diagnostics Data
In the table press on the download icon from the Actions column and send the archive as an attachment
[cid:image013.png@01DB9E30.C079FB00]Once the archive is sent, please return to the computer/user settings and disable the debug mode in one of the two ways depending on what the case is.
If you want to return the computer to the Global settings, then press the Restore Global/Default Settings button at the bottom of the page.
If you have custom rules or settings for the computer, after disabling the debug mode, just hit Save.

Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #435996 - - Mac OS Deployment Script is not working (Setting Server IP) [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Lx01X:ref ]
To gather the needed logs, please go to Device Control -> Computers or Users and filter for the PC name or User name, and hit Apply
In the Action menu of the computer/user, select Manage settings
In the Debug Mode section please select Debug from the dropdown and Save
After this please update the policies on the Computer and run the change IP script in order for the logs to be generated.
Return to the Console and go to Device Control -> Computers or users and repeat the same filter as before
In the Actions menu please select Collect Diagnostics and after 10-20 minutes In the same menu choose Go to Diagnostics Data
In the table press on the download icon from the Actions column and send the archive as an attachment
[cid:image013.png@01DB9E30.C079FB00]Once the archive is sent, please return to the computer/user settings and disable the debug mode in one of the two ways depending on what the case is.
If you want to return the computer to the Global settings, then press the Restore Global/Default Settings button at the bottom of the page.
If you have custom rules or settings for the computer, after disabling the debug mode, just hit Save.

The script was tested several times in house, and it is working without any issues, moreover, we can demonstrate this in a session to you.
Please not that this script is included in our user manual for JAMF, and it's being used by our customers for years now, without issues.

Considering the script is working on our end, and on other customers's end as well, please check if there were any modifications in your environment when the script stopped working. We're asking you to do this, because the script worked for you until it suddenly stopped working on all Macs.
In the meantime, please also send over the logs from today's remote session.

The script was tested several times in house, and it is working without any issues, moreover, we can demonstrate this in a session to you.
Please not that this script is included in our user manual for JAMF, and it's being used by our customers for years now, without issues.

Considering the script is working on our end, and on other customers's end as well, please check if there were any modifications in your environment when the script stopped working. We're asking you to do this, because the script worked for you until it suddenly stopped working on all Macs.
In the meantime, please also send over the logs from today's remote session.

Please not that this script is included in our user manual for JAMF, and it's being used by our customers for years now, without issues.

column1: I found out how to suppress the Intercept VPN notification via Intune.
To auto enable the system extension without user interaction, please check out the below screenshot:

Select Devices -> macOS > Configuration profiles > Create profile Select profile type as Templates and Extensions as template name Complete the basics and go to configuration settings and select system extensions Complete with data from ""extension"" image as listed in section 2.6 of the Jamf deployment manual: https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/pdf/manual/Endpoint_Protector_5_JAMF_Deployment_Guide_EN.pdf

Please not that this script is included in our user manual for JAMF, and it's being used by our customers for years now, without issues.

Considering the script is working on our end, and on other customers's end as well, please check if there were any modifications in your environment when the script stopped working. We're asking you to do this, because the script worked for you until it suddenly stopped working on all Macs.
In the meantime, please also send over the logs from today's remote session.

I found out how to suppress the Intercept VPN notification via Intune.
To auto enable the system extension without user interaction, please check out the below screenshot:

Select Devices -> macOS > Configuration profiles > Create profile Select profile type as Templates and Extensions as template name Complete the basics and go to configuration settings and select system extensions Complete with data from ""extension"" image as listed in section 2.6 of the Jamf deployment manual: https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/pdf/manual/Endpoint_Protector_5_JAMF_Deployment_Guide_EN.pdf

I found out how to suppress the Intercept VPN notification via Intune.
To auto enable the system extension without user interaction, please check out the below screenshot:

Select Devices -> macOS > Configuration profiles > Create profile Select profile type as Templates and Extensions as template name Complete the basics and go to configuration settings and select system extensions Complete with data from ""extension"" image as listed in section 2.6 of the Jamf deployment manual: https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/pdf/manual/Endpoint_Protector_5_JAMF_Deployment_Guide_EN.pdf

Please not that this script is included in our user manual for JAMF, and it's being used by our customers for years now, without issues.

Considering the script is working on our end, and on other customers's end as well, please check if there were any modifications in your environment when the script stopped working. We're asking you to do this, because the script worked for you until it suddenly stopped working on all Macs.
In the meantime, please also send over the logs from today's remote session.

I found out how to suppress the Intercept VPN notification via Intune.
To auto enable the system extension without user interaction, please check out the below screenshot:

Select Devices -> macOS > Configuration profiles > Create profile Select profile type as Templates and Extensions as template name Complete the basics and go to configuration settings and select system extensions Complete with data from ""extension"" image as listed in section 2.6 of the Jamf deployment manual: https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/pdf/manual/Endpoint_Protector_5_JAMF_Deployment_Guide_EN.pdf

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #435996 - - Mac OS Deployment Script is not working (Setting Server IP) [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Lx01X:ref ]
I found out how to suppress the Intercept VPN notification via Intune.
To auto enable the system extension without user interaction, please check out the below screenshot:
1.  Select Devices -> macOS > Configuration profiles > Create profile
2.  Select profile type as Templates and Extensions as template name
3.  Complete the basics and go to configuration settings and select system extensions

4.  Complete with data from ""extension"" image as listed in section 2.6 of the Jamf deployment manual: https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/pdf/manual/Endpoint_Protector_5_JAMF_Deployment_Guide_EN.pdf

I found out how to suppress the Intercept VPN notification via Intune.
To auto enable the system extension without user interaction, please check out the below screenshot:

Select Devices -> macOS > Configuration profiles > Create profile Select profile type as Templates and Extensions as template name Complete the basics and go to configuration settings and select system extensions Complete with data from ""extension"" image as listed in section 2.6 of the Jamf deployment manual: https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/pdf/manual/Endpoint_Protector_5_JAMF_Deployment_Guide_EN.pdf

The script was tested several times in house, and it is working without any issues, moreover, we can demonstrate this in a session to you.
Please not that this script is included in our user manual for JAMF, and it's being used by our customers for years now, without issues.

Considering the script is working on our end, and on other customers's end as well, please check if there were any modifications in your environment when the script stopped working. We're asking you to do this, because the script worked for you until it suddenly stopped working on all Macs.
In the meantime, please also send over the logs from today's remote session.

I found out how to suppress the Intercept VPN notification via Intune.
To auto enable the system extension without user interaction, please check out the below screenshot:

Select Devices -> macOS > Configuration profiles > Create profile Select profile type as Templates and Extensions as template name Complete the basics and go to configuration settings and select system extensions Complete with data from ""extension"" image as listed in section 2.6 of the Jamf deployment manual: https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/pdf/manual/Endpoint_Protector_5_JAMF_Deployment_Guide_EN.pdf

The script was tested several times in house, and it is working without any issues, moreover, we can demonstrate this in a session to you.
Please not that this script is included in our user manual for JAMF, and it's being used by our customers for years now, without issues.

Considering the script is working on our end, and on other customers's end as well, please check if there were any modifications in your environment when the script stopped working. We're asking you to do this, because the script worked for you until it suddenly stopped working on all Macs.
In the meantime, please also send over the logs from today's remote session.

Thank you for providing the script; it functioned effectively, allowing us to bring most of the machines online successfully.
However, it still requires the end user to ""Allow"" the Transparent Proxy, and Full Disk Access must be enabled manually.

If the Endpoint Protection Platform (EPP) considers these settings (Transparent Proxy and Full Disk Access) as essential for its optimal performance, it would be beneficial if you could provide a configuration profile. Relying on end users to manage these settings may not be the most effective approach, as they may disable them to circumvent the detection of malicious activity. Therefore, these configurations should happen in the background, without the user's awareness.
A: Masdar City, Abu Dhabi, UAE

I found out how to suppress the Intercept VPN notification via Intune.
To auto enable the system extension without user interaction, please check out the below screenshot:
1.  Select Devices -> macOS > Configuration profiles > Create profile
2.  Select profile type as Templates and Extensions as template name
3.  Complete the basics and go to configuration settings and select system extensions

4.  Complete with data from ""extension"" image as listed in section 2.6 of the Jamf deployment manual: https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/pdf/manual/Endpoint_Protector_5_JAMF_Deployment_Guide_EN.pdf

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #435996 - - Mac OS Deployment Script is not working (Setting Server IP) [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Lx01X:ref ]
Thank you for providing the script; it functioned effectively, allowing us to bring most of the machines online successfully.
However, it still requires the end user to ""Allow"" the Transparent Proxy, and Full Disk Access must be enabled manually.

If the Endpoint Protection Platform (EPP) considers these settings (Transparent Proxy and Full Disk Access) as essential for its optimal performance, it would be beneficial if you could provide a configuration profile. Relying on end users to manage these settings may not be the most effective approach, as they may disable them to circumvent the detection of malicious activity. Therefore, these configurations should happen in the background, without the user's awareness.

I found out how to suppress the Intercept VPN notification via Intune.
To auto enable the system extension without user interaction, please check out the below screenshot:

Select Devices -> macOS > Configuration profiles > Create profile Select profile type as Templates and Extensions as template name Complete the basics and go to configuration settings and select system extensions Complete with data from ""extension"" image as listed in section 2.6 of the Jamf deployment manual: https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/pdf/manual/Endpoint_Protector_5_JAMF_Deployment_Guide_EN.pdf

Please not that this script is included in our user manual for JAMF, and it's being used by our customers for years now, without issues.

Considering the script is working on our end, and on other customers's end as well, please check if there were any modifications in your environment when the script stopped working. We're asking you to do this, because the script worked for you until it suddenly stopped working on all Macs.
In the meantime, please also send over the logs from today's remote session.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #435996 - - Mac OS Deployment Script is not working (Setting Server IP) [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Lx01X:ref ]
Thank you for providing the script; it functioned effectively, allowing us to bring most of the machines online successfully.
However, it still requires the end user to ""Allow"" the Transparent Proxy, and Full Disk Access must be enabled manually.

If the Endpoint Protection Platform (EPP) considers these settings (Transparent Proxy and Full Disk Access) as essential for its optimal performance, it would be beneficial if you could provide a configuration profile. Relying on end users to manage these settings may not be the most effective approach, as they may disable them to circumvent the detection of malicious activity. Therefore, these configurations should happen in the background, without the user's awareness.
A: Masdar City, Abu Dhabi, UAE

I found out how to suppress the Intercept VPN notification via Intune.
To auto enable the system extension without user interaction, please check out the below screenshot:
1.  Select Devices -> macOS > Configuration profiles > Create profile
2.  Select profile type as Templates and Extensions as template name
3.  Complete the basics and go to configuration settings and select system extensions

4.  Complete with data from ""extension"" image as listed in section 2.6 of the Jamf deployment manual: https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/pdf/manual/Endpoint_Protector_5_JAMF_Deployment_Guide_EN.pdf

Please not that this script is included in our user manual for JAMF, and it's being used by our customers for years now, without issues.

Considering the script is working on our end, and on other customers's end as well, please check if there were any modifications in your environment when the script stopped working. We're asking you to do this, because the script worked for you until it suddenly stopped working on all Macs.
In the meantime, please also send over the logs from today's remote session.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #435996 - - Mac OS Deployment Script is not working (Setting Server IP) [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Lx01X:ref ]
Thank you for providing the script; it functioned effectively, allowing us to bring most of the machines online successfully.
However, it still requires the end user to ""Allow"" the Transparent Proxy, and Full Disk Access must be enabled manually.

If the Endpoint Protection Platform (EPP) considers these settings (Transparent Proxy and Full Disk Access) as essential for its optimal performance, it would be beneficial if you could provide a configuration profile. Relying on end users to manage these settings may not be the most effective approach, as they may disable them to circumvent the detection of malicious activity. Therefore, these configurations should happen in the background, without the user's awareness.

I found out how to suppress the Intercept VPN notification via Intune.
To auto enable the system extension without user interaction, please check out the below screenshot:

Select Devices -> macOS > Configuration profiles > Create profile Select profile type as Templates and Extensions as template name Complete the basics and go to configuration settings and select system extensions Complete with data from ""extension"" image as listed in section 2.6 of the Jamf deployment manual: https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/pdf/manual/Endpoint_Protector_5_JAMF_Deployment_Guide_EN.pdf
